p: Fungal biomass content showed a negative correlation with the C/N ratio. Although fungi are able to colonize N-poor substrates, including deadwood, due to their low N requirements [ 1, 63], the C/N ratio observed here in the youngest deadwood was very high, and its decrease definitely promoted fungal growth [ 64]. Ergosterol content is also positively correlated with the activity of all extracellular enzymes; this is not surprising if we consider that the vast majority of these enzymes are of fungal origin [ 2].
